name: Clara Barton National Historic Site
description: Clara Barton dedicated her life and energies to help others in times of need - both home and abroad, in peacetime as well as during military emergencies. Glen Echo was her home the last 15 years of her life, and the structure illustrates her dedication and concern for those less fortunate than herself.
shortDescription: Clara Barton dedicated her life and energies to help others in times of need - both home and abroad, in peacetime as well as during military emergencies. Glen Echo was her home the last 15 years of he...

operatingHours.description:
The unfurnished first floor of the Clara Barton National Historic Site is open for public visitation Fridays and Saturdays by guided tours at 1:00 pm, 2:00 pm, 3:00pm, and 4:00 pm.
Closed Sun. Dec. 25 & Sun. Jan. 1

images.title: Clara Barton National Historic Site Front View
images.altText: two and half story wooden frame house with double porch and stone corner posts.
images.caption: Clara Barton National Historic Site

images.title: Clara Barton National Historic Site West Side
images.altText: side view of Clara Barton's house with Red Cross flag and American Flag.

images.title: Front Parlor
images.altText: front parlor, two easy chairs, American Flag and Red Cross flag in corner behind one chair.
images.caption: Front Parlor, Clara Barton's favorite chair in front of flags.

images.title: Main Hallway
images.altText: large potbelly stove in center hallway with open view to third floor
images.caption: Main Hallway in Clara Barton's home.

images.title: Red Cross Windows
images.altText: Red Cross stained glass windows in room with stored furniture.
images.caption: Red Cross windows in the third floor storage room.
